title.narrative: Burkina Faso Electoral Process Support Project (2019-2021)

description.narrative:
UNDP office of Burkina Faso has applied to Sida for funding of 17, 55 million SEK to carry out the "Electoral Process Support Project during the period 2020-2021.
The intervention aims at organising free, transparent, credible and inclusive elections in 2020 and 2021, in accordance with international best practices. The project aims, specifically, to support the national actors to acquire the capacities of organization and management of electoral cycles answering the norms and international standards. It also aims to ensure the promotion of women and young people as well as the inclusive participation of all social strata in the exercise of their civic right for the free and informed choice of their representatives in the governing bodies.
The intervention’s total budget is 182 098 000 SEK (17 555 991 USD), out of which UNDP’s own funding is approximately 10 372 400 SEK (1 million USD), UNDP's Funding Windows is 9 061 960 SEK (873 659 USD) and the remaining 162 664 000 SEK (15 682 332 USD) is contributed by Sweden 15 MSEK, Denmark 11 857 000 SEK (8M DDK), the Switzerland 7 362 140 SEK (700 000 CHF), and the EU Commission contributes 99 833 000 (9M EUR).

UNDP:s landkontor i Burkina Faso har ansökt om 17,55 miljoner kronor för att genomföra projektet "Electoral Process Support Project during the period 2020-2021.
Insatsen syftar till att organisera fria, transparenta, trovärdiga och inkluderande val under 2020 och 2021, i enlighet med bästa praxis. Insatsen syftar specifikt till att stödja nationella aktörer att bygga kapacitet att organisera och genomföra valprocessen utifrån internationella normer och standarder. Insatsen syftar även till att säkerställa kvinnor och unga människors deltagande i valet liksom ett inkluderande deltagande av alla samhällsgrupper att försvara sina medborgerliga rättigheter genom fria och informerade val av representanter i valbara församlingar.
Insatsen totala budget är 182 098 000 SEK (17 555 991 USD), av vilka UNDP finansierar ca 10 372 400 SEK (1 million USD). UNDP:s finansieringsfönster är 9 061 960 SEK (873 659 USD) och kvarvarande 162 664 000 SEK (15 682 332 USD) kommer att finansieras av följande givare: Sverige med 15 000 000 SEK, Danmark med 11 857 000 SEK (8M DDK), Schweiz med 7 362 140 SEK (700 000 CHF), och EU-kommissionen med 99 833 000 SEK (9M EUR).

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

description.narrative: Component 1: Support for Capacity Building and Electoral Operations The support to CENI resulted mainly in the training of 2,248 trainers of polling station members at the provincial level and 105,570 polling station members on the management of polling and counting stations; the provision of 11 experts and resource persons in the areas of communication, training, gender, early warning, logistics, election law, computer science; graphic design (02) and journalism (02). In addition, CENI was provided with electoral hardware and software. Finally, the project provided financial support for the care of 147,000 polling station members. In terms of logistics, computer hardware, software, servers, energy production equipment and various other services were acquired and made available to CENI. Component 2: Support for communication, civic education and awareness for greater citizen participation. In collaboration with the Superior Council of Communication (CSC), the project trained 1,100 journalists from 30 media outlets on electoral ethics and the promotion of a credible and peaceful electoral process; and 200 observers on the monitoring of speeches during the electoral campaign. In total, at least 1,300 actors improved their capacity to cover critical phases of the electoral process. Component 3: Support for Electoral Conflict Prevention and Management The project trained 194 people from the Constitutional Council (CC), the Council of State (CE), and CENI on the management of electoral disputes. By strengthening the capacities of these actors, the project has contributed to strengthening the judicial institution which, according to the First Acting President of the Council of State, should be "the channel through which any dispute arising from the electoral process is settled. Component 4: Support for the participation of women and young people The Project in partnership with the National Democratic Institute (NDI), organized coaching sessions for 400 women candidates to increase their chances of success in the presidential and legislative elections. Through these sessions, the participants improved their skills in electoral communication; campaign fundraising; campaign management; leadership; and public speaking. At the Management Level The rate of execution of the resources mobilized, i.e. 14,747,773 dollars at December 31, 2020, was 69.55%. It should be noted that the contribution from Italy, received in December 2020, will be used in the framework of the implementation of the Annual work plan 2021.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
